name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0
description: Framework for improving critical infrastructure cybersecurity

govern.name: Govern
govern.description: Establish and monitor cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy

categories.name: Organizational Context
outcomes: GV.OC-01: Mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management
GV.OC-02: Internal and external stakeholders are identified
GV.OC-03: Legal and regulatory requirements are understood
GV.OC-04: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services are determined
GV.OC-05: Outcomes and priorities are established and communicated

categories.name: Risk Management Strategy
outcomes: GV.RM-01: Risk management objectives are established and agreed upon
GV.RM-02: Risk appetite and tolerance statements are established
GV.RM-03: Strategic direction is informed by cybersecurity risk
GV.RM-04: Resource allocation includes cybersecurity risk
GV.RM-05: Criteria for escalation are established

categories.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
outcomes: GV.SC-01: Supply chain risk management program is established
GV.SC-02: Roles and responsibilities are defined
GV.SC-03: Supply chain risk management is integrated
GV.SC-04: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality

identify.name: Identify
identify.description: Understand cybersecurity risks to systems, people, assets, data, and capabilities

categories.name: Asset Management
outcomes: ID.AM-01: Hardware inventories are maintained
ID.AM-02: Software inventories are maintained
ID.AM-03: Network mapping is documented
ID.AM-04: External information systems are catalogued
ID.AM-05: Resources are prioritized based on criticality

categories.name: Risk Assessment
outcomes: ID.RA-01: Vulnerabilities are identified and documented
ID.RA-02: Threat intelligence is received and analyzed
ID.RA-03: Threats are identified and documented
ID.RA-04: Potential impacts are identified
ID.RA-05: Risks are assessed and prioritized

categories.name: Improvement
outcomes: ID.IM-01: Improvements are identified from evaluations
ID.IM-02: Improvements are identified from testing
ID.IM-03: Improvements are identified from incidents

protect.name: Protect
protect.description: Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk

categories.name: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control
outcomes: PR.AA-01: Identities and credentials are managed
PR.AA-02: Identities are proofed and bound
PR.AA-03: Users, devices, and services are authenticated
PR.AA-04: Identity assertions are protected
PR.AA-05: Access permissions are managed

categories.name: Awareness and Training
outcomes: PR.AT-01: Personnel are provided awareness and training
PR.AT-02: Personnel understand their roles

categories.name: Data Security
outcomes: PR.DS-01: Data-at-rest is protected
PR.DS-02: Data-in-transit is protected
PR.DS-10: Data-in-use is protected
PR.DS-11: Backups are performed and protected

categories.name: Platform Security
outcomes: PR.PS-01: Configuration management is established
PR.PS-02: Software is maintained and replaced
PR.PS-03: Hardware is maintained and replaced
PR.PS-04: Logs are collected and analyzed
PR.PS-05: Installation and execution of unauthorized software is prevented

categories.name: Technology Infrastructure Resilience
outcomes: PR.IR-01: Networks and environments are protected
PR.IR-02: Assets are protected against exploitation
PR.IR-03: Assets are protected against unauthorized access
PR.IR-04: Adequate resource capacity is maintained

detect.name: Detect
detect.description: Find and analyze possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises

categories.name: Continuous Monitoring
outcomes: DE.CM-01: Networks are monitored for potential attacks
DE.CM-02: Physical environment is monitored
DE.CM-03: Personnel activity is monitored
DE.CM-06: External service provider activity is monitored
DE.CM-09: Computing hardware is monitored

categories.name: Adverse Event Analysis
outcomes: DE.AE-02: Potentially adverse events are analyzed
DE.AE-03: Events are correlated
DE.AE-04: Impact of events is estimated
DE.AE-06: Information on adverse events is provided
DE.AE-07: Threat hunting is performed
DE.AE-08: Incidents are declared

respond.name: Respond
respond.description: Take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident

categories.name: Incident Management
outcomes: RS.MA-01: Incident response plan is executed
RS.MA-02: Incidents are triaged and validated
RS.MA-03: Incidents are categorized
RS.MA-04: Incidents are escalated
RS.MA-05: Incident data are analyzed

categories.name: Incident Analysis
outcomes: RS.AN-03: Forensic analysis is performed
RS.AN-06: Root cause is determined
RS.AN-07: Incidents are assessed for broader impact

categories.name: Incident Response Reporting and Communication
outcomes: RS.CO-02: Internal stakeholders are notified
RS.CO-03: External stakeholders are notified

categories.name: Incident Mitigation
outcomes: RS.MI-01: Incidents are contained
RS.MI-02: Incidents are eradicated

recover.name: Recover
recover.description: Restore capabilities or services impaired by a cybersecurity incident

categories.name: Incident Recovery Plan Execution
outcomes: RC.RP-01: Recovery plan is executed
RC.RP-02: Recovery actions are selected and scoped
RC.RP-03: Integrity of backups is verified
RC.RP-04: Critical functions are restored
RC.RP-05: Integrity of restored assets is verified
RC.RP-06: End of incident is declared

categories.name: Incident Recovery Communication
outcomes: RC.CO-03: Recovery activities are communicated
RC.CO-04: Public updates on recovery are shared

tier_2.name: Risk Informed
tier_2.description: Risk management practices approved but not organization-wide

tier_3.name: Repeatable
tier_3.description: Formally approved and expressed as policy

tier_4.name: Adaptive
tier_4.description: Adapts based on lessons learned and predictive indicators
